intro: Haplopappus mollis, commonly known as the narrowleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its small, daisy-like yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has slender, hairy stems and narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Haplopappus mollis is known for its ability to thrive in arid environments and is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
